result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephan J Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendnat is not to enter onto the grounds/premises of the Stone Lake Convenience Store located at 5326 Fire Keeper Road, Crandon, WI.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Stephan J Daniels
Current: PO Box 495, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 02-28-2020)
Prior: 5586 Kwe Da Kik Court, Crandon, WI 54520
Revoked - Sentenced to Jail

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:26 AM. Called 16CF208 and 16CM159. Court - last time in Court this matter was rescheduled due to defense attorney wanting to look into the defendant's recent treatment history. Joy has sense done that, was planning on preparing a memo to the court in regards to that but has not prepared that memo. Joy gives brief overview of what he learned thru reading the many pages of treatment notes. State makes final argument prior to his recommendation - 6 months in FC jail on each count with each count in each case running concurrent to each other but for the two cases - the time would run consecutive (time on 16CF208 to run consecutive to time on 16CM159) in each case - does have 137 days credit (stipulated to). Joy makes final argument prior to his recommenation - recommends 4 months in the county jail, concurrent to each other within the case but consecutive to each of the two cases - credit for 137 days. Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 16M159 - 4 months in FC jail on counts #3 and #4 - concurrent to each other; on 16CF208 - count #2 - 5 months in FC jail, Count #3 - 4 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #3 but consecutive to time on 16CM159 - huber and good time allowed - credit for 137 days on 16CF208 - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 18, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM159 and 16CF208. Called 1:18 PM. Here for sentencing after revocation. Joy has received revocation packet and no inaccuracies. State - recites criminal history and is recommending on 16CF208 - counts 2 & 3 - asking for  6 months in FC jail on each count concurrent to each other. 16CM159 - counts 3 & 4 - 6 months in FC jail on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to 16CF208. Joy makes statement. Court questions treatment Joy is stating Daniels had went to. Discussion regarding treatment. Court will adjourn to allow Joy to gather proof of being enrolled in treatment.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 18, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:53 PM. Called 16CF208, 16CM130, 16CM131, 16CM132, 16CM159 and 16CM21. State - resolved - 16CM21 - amend only count to county ordinance of obstructing with a $500 fineplus costs; 16CM130 - #1 - amend to county ordinance of possession of THC with a $500.00 fine plus costs, #2 - DRI, #3 - plead as alleged with joint recommendation of court costs and 10 days jail - time served; 16CM131 and 16CM132 - pay restiution of $8.95 on 16CM131 and $3.58 on 16CM132 and then those cases would be DRI; 16CM159 - plead g/nc to counts #3 and #4 as alleged, all other counts to be DRI, on counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with court costs only plus additional conditions that will be stated later; on 16CF208 - amend count #1 to misd failure to report to jail contrary to 946.425(1m) - 120 days in jail - concurrent to jail on 16CM130 - 119 days credit (time served), court costs; on 16CF208 - on counts #2 and #3 - plead as alleged with 2 years probation, remaining counts to be DRI; conditions of probation would include: AODA and follow thru, restitution as indicated to be paid today, maintian absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community sevice, no entry onto the ground of the Potawatomi Convenience Store located at 5326 Fire Keeper Road, Crandon, WI. Cirilli and Daniels agree and states that the defendant does have a HS diploma. Daniels knows what it means when charges are DRI. Court - 16CM21 - amend to county ordinance of obstructing, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO; 16CM132 - dismissed after restitution of $3.58 is paid before the end of the day or all cases will be re-opened; 16CM131 - dismised after $8.95 is paid; 16CM159 - DRI counts #1, #2, #5, #6, #7, #8, #9, #10 and #11. Daniels pleads NC to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. 16CF208 - DRI #4, #5 and #6, amends count #1 to failure to report to jail contrary to 946.425(1m) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads NC, pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as allged; 16CM130 - amend count #1 to co unty ordinacne of possession of THC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, DRI #2, pleads NC to count #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Daniels makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM159 - #3 and #4 and 16CF208 - counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, costs on all counts , maintian absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community sevice(16CF208 only), no entry onto the ground of the Potawatomi Convenience Store located at 5326 Fire Keeper Road, Crandon, WI; count #1 - 120 days straight  - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(1), #3 - 16CM130 - costs and 10 days jail - concurrent to jail on 16CF208 - huber and good time allowed  - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - counsel to prepare stipulation for credit time, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendants to state's DFD
State's
Final pre-trial on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:33 PM. Also called companion case of 16CF194. State calls Deputy Sergeant Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 2:36 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of both defendants (2:45 PM). Cross exam by Hogan at 2:49 PM. Cross exam by Erickson at 2:52 PM. State objects to use of CI reference - overruled (2:52 PM). State objects - sustained (2:56 PM). Ashbeck excused at 2:59 PM. State calls Detective Sergeant Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 3:00 PM. Direct exam by State. Hogan objects - form of question - sustained (3:12 PM). State will be asking for a material witness warrant for CI Nathan Vanzile. Cross exam by Hogan at 3:13 PM. State asks for material witness warrant. Court - not needed - probable cause has already been established. Cross exam by Erickson at 3:20 PM. Robinson excused at 3:23 PM. Court finds probable cause on both cases, binds both defendants over for trial. State files Information on both cases that are consistent with the complaints. Erickson waives reading of Information and pleads NG to all counts for her client. Court accepts NG pleas for Ms. Wagnitz. Hogan has Information, waives reading of it, will also proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bonds on both cases, sets both cases for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on January 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:01, Called 16CF208, 16CM132, 16CM21, 16CM131, and 16CM159. Cirilli and Daniels have all complaints. Cirilli is representing the defendant on all cases, waives further reading of any complaints, enters NG pleas to all counts on the CM matters, asks for PH on 16CF208, sets for PH on 12/4/17 at 3:00 PM, waiving time limits for PH, asking that all other matters be set for STC on same date and time. Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Stephan J Daniels in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:14 AM. Called 16CF208, 16CM132, 16CM131, 16CM159, 16CM21 and 16CM130. Cirilli states that he is only representing the defendant on 16CM130 and have already gone thru the initial processes. Court sets 16CM130 for JT, bond is $5000.00 cash with conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into Forest County Potawatomi Convenience Store in Stone Lake, WI.. On all the other matters, set all for another AIA, continues bond on all matters, sets all matters for AIA on 12/7/16 at 9:30 AM.
Initial appearance on November 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol.
appeared in court

Defendant Stephan J Daniels in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:06 AM. CAlled 16CF208, 16CM21,16CM131, 16CM132 and 16CM159. State - 16CF208 is an initial appearance and believes all other matters are return on a warrant for not returning after being let out on a furlough. Court looks at all the cases. Court - start with 16CF208 - Daniels has complaint - Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Court continues bond on this case and will set for AIA. Joy has a conflict with the cases and cannot represent the defendant. 16CM131 - defendant appears without counsel, discussion on if Gary Cirilli represents. Court - bond - $2000.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into the Forest County Potawatomi Convenience Store, set for AIA on 11/30/16 at 10:00 AM. Court - 16CM132 - bond - $4000.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into the Forest County Potawatomi Convenience Store and set for AIA on 11/30/16 at 10:00 AM. Court - 16CM159 - $4000.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol, AIA on 11/30/16 at 10:00 AM. Court - 16CM21 - set for AIA on 11/30/16 at 10:00 AM, $1000.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into the Forest County Potawatomi Convenience Store.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on November 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Stephan J Daniels not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. Called 16CM21, 16CM131, 16CM132, and 16CM159. State requests warrants for the defendant's arrest. Court - 16CM159 - issues bench warrant, body or $5,000.00; 16CM131 - issues bench warrant, body or $2,000.00; 16CM21 - issues bench warrant, body or $3,000.00 and on 16CM132 - issues bench warrant, body or $4,000.00. Court - Cirilli has indicated off record that he is the attorney for Mr. Daniels only on one case, Court puts on the record that the defendant was released on a furlough and failed to return and will have charges forthcoming for that.
Cash bond set.
No consumption of alcohol.
